column3: BODY AREA
column4: PERSON

column3: Feel that area holding something vibrating. It is moving towards your mouth. Through your throat. Trying to get out.
column4: Hear that person chewing very loudly.

column3: You put your hand on that area to make the vibrating stop. You try to control your breathing. Nothing helps.
column4: Their lips move but you can't hear them. Yell their name. They can hear you but they act like they don't.

column3: Feel how that area is trembling. It is supposed to be solid but something is keeping it from being still. A deep roar is too far from your throat to get out.
column4: Now is your chance to tell them what you really think. How they made you feel. They look smug.

column3: Imagine that area being filled by angry bees. You try to shake them off but they won't leave.
column4: Imagine asking that person for help. They heard you but they don't move. They laugh at you.

column3: Feel and here the loud rumbling in that area. High pressure. Cracks open up to let out lava but the pressure never drops.
column4: Feel the weight of the rock in your hand. Feel the urge of throwing it as hard as you can at the person in front of you.

column3: Imagine that area growing and burning and festering like touching an open sore.
column4: Imagine that person betraying you and then shrugging.

column3: Imagine a piece of that area missing. You see it in someone else. No matter how hard you try to bring it back you can’t even reach it.
column4: Imagine them obliviously holding on to your missing piece.

column3: Imagine that area beeing filled with black tar. The tar is slowly seeping out. Poisoning the rest of your body.
column4: Imagine pushing them as hard as you can. Did you think it would make you feel better? It won't.

column3: Maybe if you try to clean up that area you'll feel better. You make an attempt but don't know where to start. You give up.
column4: You avoid making eyecontact with them. The less you engage the less you have to pretend.

column3: You fail to remember the last time that area got to experience the rays of our sun. It's damp and cold.
column4: They try to tell you a joke. You're not sure if you missed the punchline. You don't even bother to pretend.

column3: Feel how the area gets hit by gray, gravel like forces from the outside world. The area cannot withstand.
column4: Hear them complain.

column3: Feel the area grow and start to pour out of your body until it fills the room.
column4: You are looking around for them but you can barely see them through the fog.

column3: Imagine that area inside your body, all of you inside your dirty PJs, afternoon dragging into evening.
column4: They find you laying on the floor next to your bed.

column3: Let your mind shift focus from one side of that area to the other. Feel how they both represent a different side of true.
column4: If you approach them they might leave. If you don’t, they might be offended.

column3: Feel the emptiness there.
column4: They can't see you.

column3: Feel how deep the black void in that area is.
column4: You don't exist to them.

column3: Anything you find in that area is waste.
column4: They don't want your help. They don't want you there.

column3: Follow that area as it drops down into the ground.
column4: Feel your vision blur as you try to keep listening to them. Try to keep caring. Feel your energy draining.

column3: Attempt to scoop it off the floor, feel its weight.
column4: Feel your eyes droop and shoulders slump as you try to get somewhere new with them. It feels impossible.

column3: Follow that area as it drops down into the ground.
column4: Feel your vision blur as you try to keep listening to them. Try to keep caring. Feel your energy draining.

column3: Feel that area flicker barely into your consciousness then it's gone. Oh well.
column4: Let that person fill up your mind for a moment then let them float by. See how you can play with their presence. Bringing them back and letting them go.

column3: Feel how this area has taken over. You’re trying to focus on other parts of your body but it won’t let you. It’s like looking through a jumpy fog.
You wish this area were smaller, less noticable. Can everyone around you feel it too?
column4: Notice how much more confident they seem. How much more together they seem to have it.

column3: Why does that area stand out to you? There must be something wrong.
column4: You look to them for reassurance but they confirm your uncertainty. Something feels off.

column3: There’s no movement there. The walls are like frozen rock but it’s not clear where they begin or end.
column4: Why are they faceless? You’re trying to move away but you can’t. They are getting closer.

column3: The area is too loud. You need to shift focus. You try to follow one of multiple paths, out to a calmer area in your body. It leads back to the same place. Every time.
column4: The person is pointing towards something behind you. You turn around and look. There is nothing there. You turn back. They are gone. You can still hear their voice.

column3: Feel that area dissolve. The sensation along with the world surrounding you gets vaguer and vaguer.
column4: Imagine them moving their lips without any sound leaving their mouth.

column3: Feel that area tremble in a soft high paced manner. If the rhythm is disrupted, you will scatter.
column4: Feel how you need them to stay. How you want them to hold your hand.

column3: You don't dare to investigate the area too much. Anything that enters runs the risk of dissapearing forever. A deep black hole. Right in the middle.
column4: Are you sure it's really them? You can't see their face. You try to get closer but it's like an unknown force keeps moving them just out of reach. You get whifts of there scent. Or is it mildew? You collapse. They hover above you. Like a heaavy, dense fog.

column3: There's a warm inviting glow. You try to put your hand in it but there's a thick, transparent membrane that won't let you through. You watch from a distance. Is there really no way to enter?
column4: If you were to run up and hug them they'd disappear. You just know. So you just stand there. Fighting the urge.

column3: An ache deep in there, tracing the edges of your organs as it moves upward. You crane my neck, pushing it down as you look away.
column4: See them waving, then tiring out, and finally getting distracted by everyone around them.

column3: The whole area is turning into liquid. Nothing is holdig it together anylonger.
column4: The stormy water is everywhere. They're drifting away. Do something! Grab them! You can barely see them but you still hear them scream for you.

column3: Feel the stillness there. There’s an absence of play yet there’s nothing heavy about it.
column4: There’s something important you need them to know. Transfer the core of it to them without using any words.

column3: Feel how parts of that area have started to rot. The smell makes it difficult to sense other parts of your body. Feel how it is slowly spreading.
column4: Feel how they’re doing it wrong. Every little movement. Even the intention of moving. You could do it better.

column3: Feel that area fill with simmering black tar. Let it boil over.
column4: Imagine them poking you, prodding. You push back. How do you get at them?

column3: Focus on the movement in that area. It causes no ripples. Details are solemn. Time is irrelevant.
column4: Look deep into that person's eyes. Feel whatever it is their eyes are telling you.

column3: Imagine a slow and warm pulsation in that area. It brings a sensation of safety.
column4: Imagine radiating exactly what they need to feel loved and safe. Feel their love reflected back on you.

column3: Feel that area relax more and more. As it realxes feel how it becomes a source of energy for the rest of your body.
column4: Know that you wouldn't be hear if it wasn't for them.

column3: Imagine that area being filled with a strong but pleasant white light. The light spreads to the rest of your body. It knocks out your outer senses while giving your inner senses orgasms.
column4: They make the white light in your body even brighter. You can't hear what they're saying but. You can't stop smiling.

column3: Feel that area relax. The more it relaxes the stronger it gets.
column4: Pay close attention to that person. What do they radiate?

column3: Feel that area crack open, revealing an infinite space with sparkling white light.
Feel how that area is being tickled.
column4: Tell them a joke. Hear them laugh. See how they can't stop laughing.

column3: Feel how the energy of that area is spreading to the rest of your body. Slowly untying knots. It gets easier to move.
column4: They're giving you a thumbs up. Feel how their support fills your body.

column3: Feel a large opening fill with moving air. It’s hard to inhale with the fullness. A little bit light headed. Keep moving, keep moving.
An enormous amount of energy is moving around that area. It's looking for actions to take.
column4: See that person walking towards you with firm steps. Grabbing your shoulders.

column3: Imagine a light but powerful flow making its way through that area and to the rest of your body. It makes it easy to breath. It opens up inner worlds that reaches way beyond the boundaries of your body.
column4: Imagine that person taking you by your hand, leading you to an elevated spot within the space. From there you can see beyond the confines of the space. They look excited.

column3: Feel a large opening fill with moving air. It’s hard to inhale with the fullness. A little bit light headed. Keep moving, keep moving.
column4: See yourself daring them. With gleaming eyes, they double dare you. You both hold your breath and jump.

column3: See the remnants of old perspectives that held you captive in this area. You move freely through them now. They get more and more frail the more you move.
column4: Imagine that person offering you a drink.

column3: Let that area spread slowly through your body, moving organ by organ. Feel the tension dissipate.
column4: Imagine them giving you a head massage.

column3: Feel that area effortlessly bring home all the known pieces. Every piece, whether it fits or not, is right where it is supposed to be.
column4: Feel how okay it is to not understand everything about that person.

column3: Feel that area getting clearer and clearer. And as it does it opens up more and more.
column4: They're looking at you and you can tell they're really seeing you. All the way through.

column3: Let the clarity of this area expand. Feel water moving through it in a straight line.
column4: Bring their face into focus. Let everything else fade away.

column3: Breath in deeply feeling energy radiate from your core to your fingers and toes.
column4: Imagine holding each other up, looking out into the distance together.
